markdownRemark.html:
We don’t choose our parents. Most people haven’t reflected on the fact that we were born to this world that is out of our control. I hope I can capture my deep appreciation of this in this blog post.

I was born to a poor family in San Ildefonso, a town two hours from Mnaila, the Philippines’s Capital in 1985. A year later, the longest running dictatorship fell down due to a democratic movement so infectious it was modeled by countries. Was I lucky to be born in a third world country?

If I was born in America - I could worked with a decent job as a software engineer in a tech firm or I could have been a founder of a cool technology. But I could have endured the catasthrophe of 9/11 bombing in 2001. A high chance of getting so much student debt and graduating only to find out that the market is crashing in 2008.

If I was born in Germany -

If
